result.execSummary:
The defendant Brent Ian Godersky was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court costs due during term of probation. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription. Contact with GWG and CRG only with their and the Agent's approval. Any counseling or programing including anger management and or DV counseling by the Agent. Submit to DNA analysis.

supervisions.notes: Court costs due during term of probation on count 1. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

2:01 PM Defendant Brent Ian Godersky in court.  Attorney Kirk R. Emick in court for Brent Ian Godersky.  Prosecuting attorney Benjamin Lindsay in court for the State of Wisconsin.

2:06 PM Prosecuting attorney Adam Yale Gerol in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brent Ian Godersky in court.  Attorney Kirk R. Emick in court for Brent Ian Godersky. Counsel previously efile plea questionnaire. Court examines Defendant on change of plea to guilty and finds Defendant guilty of counts 1 and 2. State will recommend at sentencing: Count 1 - 7 months I/S 1 year probation w/conditions: Absolute sobriety, Contact with CWG and CRG only with their and the Agent's approval, any treatment programming including anger management and DV counseling; Count 2 - 20 days jail. Port Washington PD incident 22-006505 read in and not charged. Bail to continue until sentencing.
